name: Neon Windbreaker - New Sky
description:
Pre-order for Neon Windbreaker's New Sky 7". Released by We Are Busy Bodies and Scion Sessions. Now Shipping.

The record is FREE to order, you just pay for the shipping.  Please email orders@wearebusybodies.com with questions. Shipping will be: $3 - Canada, $4 - USA, $5 - Europe. If ordering from elsewhere, please email first.  

Limited to 500 copies.

Track Info:
A. Jamesbud
A. Younger
A: Nails
B: New Sky
B: Pink Suit

name: The Elwins - Forgetful Assistance/Countdown 7"
description:
First 7" single by Keswick, Ontario pop kings The Elwins.

Side A: Forgetful Assistance
Side B: Countdown (Beyonce Cover) feat. Luke Lalonde

Limited to 1000 Copies. Orange vinyl. 

Ships immediately. Copies will be available from Affairs of The Heart in Europe at the end of April.

name: Neon Windbreaker - S/T LP
description:
Debut LP from Toronto's Neon Windbreaker. 

Featuring past and present members of Modern Superstitions, Beliefs, Sam Coffey and the Iron Lungs, Rituals and many other bands. 

Stream the album over at Exclaim - http://exclaim.ca/MusicVideo/ClickHear/neon_windbreaker-untitled_album_stream

Clear vinyl. Limited to 500 copies.

name: Julie Doiron & The Wrong Guys
description:
Debut single by Julie Doiron & the Wrong Guys, featuring Eamon McGrath, plus Cancer Bats members Mike Peters and Jaye Schwarzer. 

Limited to 500 copies. 

Side A: Heartbeats
Side B: Swan Pond

Record is in stores on September 18th. Pre-orders will ship on September 10th.

name: Limblifter - S/T LP reissue
description:
Limblifter materialized "inside an abandoned meat locker, amidst the hooker and drug infested Yaletown district of Vancouver" while brothers Ryan and Kurt Dahle took some time away from their full-time gig, Age of Electric. Linking up with bassist Ian Somers, the band practised just ten times before they laid down Limblifter in a four-day studio stint.

Originally released on CD and cassette in 1996, Limblifter's debut LP will see a reissue on 180 gram white vinyl on July 24. Pre-order now available. Record was delayed, arrived in our hands July 24th, has begun shipping. Limited to 1000 copies.

name: Gary Wilson - My Eyes Are Closed 7"
description:
Gary Wilson emerged from New York's DIY movement with 1977's proto-New Wave masterpiece You Think You Really Know Me, an extraordinary record which has been known to suck unprepared new listeners in like a drug and never let go. Shortly after its limited release its creator simply vanished.

25 years later, Gary was found, and has since released a number of albums, performed sold out shows and has had a rebirth of sorts.

We Are Busy Bodies is proud to release a limited edition flexi 7" for Mr. Wilson. Limited to 250 copies.

1. My Eyes Are Closed
2. My Dream Is YOurs

name: Shellshag - Stars n Bars 7"
description:
In attempts to dance about Shellshagʼs architecture, they’ve been explained as an amalgam of The Breeders, Sonic Youth, The Ramones, DFA, David Byrne, Guided By Voices, Moldy Peaches and early Superchunk—and, because they’re a male guitarist/female drummer duo, those touch points (Jack and Meg, Matt and Kim, Juicifer) get tossed around like so much confetti, too.

We Are Busy Bodies is releasing a new 7" for the band, which will be shipping as of June 19, 2012. Limited to 400 copies. 

SIDE A:
1. Stars n Bars
2. In The Pink
 
SIDE B:
1. Starting Line
2. No More War

name: International Zombies of Love - IZOL
description:
The acronym-titled debut (IZOL) is a collection of seven stunning tracks written by core project lead Mike Farrell.

Album will be in stores May 15th and can now be ordered through We Are Busy Bodies in advance of the release date.

name: CA Smith - Someone You Love
description:
New 14-song LP from singer-songwriter CA Smith. Smith has performed under the moniker Mayor McCA for the past 15 years. Operating as a one-man band he borrowed the term, and half jokingly, referred to himself as “The hardest working man in showbiz”, funny but no less true. It’s safe to say that as a vaudeville style act (singing, playing, and tap dancing) he turned a few heads.

The charismatic Smith has gained recognition among his peers as a hard working talent. That reputation led to opening slots for Feist, Daniel Johnston, Chad VanGaalen, Slow Club, Noisettes, and more. Beyond his hard work, the real achievement has been the songs and that’s the reason for the new direction Smith has chosen.

After five albums, and two tribute shows the focus is being placed solely on songwriting. As a solo act (or occasionally with a backing band) Smith will showcase his new direction and let the music speak for itself.

name: Rock Plaza Central - Cow and Bird 7"
description:
Limited edition single as part of the We Are Busy Bodies single series by Toronto folk/rock storytellers Rock Plaza Central.

100 copies have been printed on clear flexi vinyl, 60 of which are available for sale.


Side A: Cow and Bird
Side B: I Want You

* cost includes shipping to wherever records can be shipped to.

name: AIDS Wolf  - Soaked in Oil 7"
description:
One-sided flexi 7" by AIDS Wolf. Two exclusive tracks on a blue square flexi record with art by Seripop (the band themselves).

The flexi is the fifth in our series and is limited to 200 available copies. 

Track Listings:
1. Soaked in Oil
2. Foreign Hairs


** Previous releases were limited to 100 copies, however we had to switch vinyl manufacturers as our original supplier had to stop operations. Price reflects cost of manufacturing record, printing artwork, cost of shipping materials and shipping itself.

name: Odonis Odonis - Busted Lip 7"
description:
First 7" release for Toronto-based Odonis Odonis.

A: Busted Lip
B: Handle Bars

Limited to 100 copies on clear vinyl. Pre-order now available. Will ship in late April (pressing delays). 

Shipping is included in the pricing to anywhere that records can be shipped to.

name: Young Governor - Married Man 7"
description:
One-sided 7" by Ben Cook, aka Young Governor, who's personal release discography borders on ridiculous as a member of No Warning, Surplus Sons, Marvelous Darlings, The Bitters, Fucked Up, Violent Minds, etc. 

Limited to 100 copies on clear vinyl. Record ships mid-February 2011. 

This record is now SOLD OUT as an individual order. There are a few copies left for the complete single series. There will be 35 copies available directly from Young Governor as of mid-February.

name: Doldrums - Euphoria 7"
description:
Limited edition flexi 7" as part of the We Are Busy Bodies flexi single series by Toronto/Montreal artist Doldrums. Experimental pop perfection.

A: Euphoria
B: Strange Waves

name: TV Buddhas - S/T
description:
S/T EP by Tel Aviv by way of Berlin bubblegum punks TV Buddhas:

1. Let Me Sleep
2. Going Out On Satrday
3. Hip Street
4. Defies Definition
5. Fast Generation
6. Fun Girls

name: Japanther / Viking Club
description: We Are Busy Bodies first release from 2005. A split CD between Brooklyn lo-fi punks Japanther and long broken up Toronto band Viking Club. Members of Viking Club went on to form DD/MM/YYYY who currently can be seen performing on stages around the world.

name: The Deathset - Limitations Make Us Creative
description:
Noise-y electro punk from Brooklyn by way of the Cold Coast of Australia and Baltimore. Contemporaries of Japanther, Ninjasonik, Matt & Kim etc. Last release before they signed to Ninja Tune.

"Has the maximum-impact intensity of the young Henry Rollins in Black Flag or like an Iggy Pop for the era of samples and laptops. Worldwide is an extraordinary offering. The Death Set are a quixotic, perfect pop thrill." The Guardian

name: Japanther - Skuffed Up My Huffy
description: Canadian release of Skuffed Up My Huffy by Japanther.

name: Zoobombs - Live 7"
description: Live 7" taken from a soundboard recording by Japan's The Zoobombs on one of their trips to Canada. Limited edition 7" on three colours of vinyl.

name: Cuff The Duke - I Guess This Is Life 7"
description:
Cuff The Duke released their latest full-length "Way Down Here" in Canada in September 2009 and recorded a few extra tracks in the process for this single.

Side A: I Guess This Is Life
Side B: Red Shoes

Limited to 500 copies.

name: DD/MM/YYYY - Blue Screen of Death
description:
First full-length album by Toronto experimental rock weirdos DD/MM/YYYY. The first 500 copies were silkscreened onto cardboard packages which quickly sold out, annoying record shops in the process for its slightly too large to fit in row packaging. 

This is the second print of the album, which is a great starting point if you are beginning to familiarize yourself with their discography.

name: DD/MM/YYYY - Are They Masks?
description: DD/MM/YYYY's road warrior touring ethic comes front and center on their critically acclaimed second full-length album.

name: DD/MM/YYYY - Black Square
description: Black Square, has been heralded as the critically acclaimed breakthrough album for DD/MM/YYYY. Find out why by picking up a copy of their third full-length.

name: Andre Charles Theriault - Sings The Songs Of
description: First full-length album from singer-songwriter Andre Charles Theriault. Having honed his live show performing alongside Mt. Eerie, The Blow, Chad VanGaalen and other contemporaries, his recorded output captures the beauty of his voice over his intricate guitar work.

name: Mayor McCa - Cue Are Est Tea You
description:
Mayor McCa (born as Christian Anderson Smith) is a Canadian musician, writer, cartoonist, animator, actor and onetime mayoral candidate from Hamilton, Ontario. He mostly performs as a one-man band.

Mayor McCa currently lives and performs in London, England. He toured with Finger Eleven, Noisettes, Feist, Slow Club, Nick Oliveri and Blag Dahlia, as well as appearing at the Secret Garden Party festival. He recently toured with Bob Log III and the The Magic Numbers in early 2009. He has also played extensively in Canada.

His album Cue Are Es Tea You continues the series of albums rounding out the alphabet.
